conclusion: Consider the electric field due to each point charge and their interaction.
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Coulomb's constant k is 8.99 x 10^9 N m^2/C^2.
Diagonals of the square intersect at the center, midpoint of diagonals is at the origin (0,0).
Distance from origin to any point on diagonals is L√2.
Electric field at the origin due to point charge q is E = kq/(L√2)^2 = kq/2L^2.
Electric field at intersection is vector sum of fields due to charges at A and B.
Electric field at A is E_A = kq/2L^2.
Electric field at B is E_B = kq/2L^2.
Electric field at intersection is E_intersection = E_A + E_B = kq/L^2.
Electric field strength at intersection of diagonals is kq/L^2.
